intro: Gamogyne colata, commonly known as the yellow-flowered gamogyne, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Gamogyne colata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
